entry.title: Cross-tissue multicellular coordination and its rewiring in cancer (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Cross-tissue multicellular coordination and its rewiring in cancer

Comprehensive single-cell transcriptomic analysis of 35 human tissues reveals 12 cross-tissue coordinated cellular modules that exhibit intramodule communication and dynamic changes with ageing, and whose organization is perturbed during cancer progression.

  • Qiang Shi
  • Yihan Chen
  • Zemin Zhang
ArticleOpen Access28 May 2025

entry.title: CoQ imbalance drives reverse electron transport to disrupt liver metabolism (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
CoQ imbalance drives reverse electron transport to disrupt liver metabolism

Reverse electron transport is the mechanism behind excess mitochondrial reactive oxygen species in the livers of obese mice, which has implications for developing therapeutics for fatty liver disease in humans.

  • Renata L. S. Goncalves
  • Zeqiu Branden Wang
  • Gökhan S. Hotamışlıgil
Article28 May 2025

entry.title: Detection of X-ray emission from a bright long-period radio transient (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Detection of X-ray emission from a bright long-period radio transient

A long-period radio transient with coincident radio and X-ray emission and observational properties unlike any known Galactic object has been observed by the Australian Square Kilometre Array Pathfinder.

  • Ziteng Wang
  • Nanda Rea
  • Nithyanandan Thyagarajan
Article28 May 2025

entry.title: Two distinct host-specialized fungal species cause white-nose disease in bats (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Two distinct host-specialized fungal species cause white-nose disease in bats

The identification of two cryptic species of the fungal pathogen that causes white-nose disease in bats highlights the need to integrate studies of genetic variability in pathogens into disease surveillance, management and prevention strategies.

  • Nicola M. Fischer
  • Imogen Dumville
  • Sebastien J. Puechmaille
ArticleOpen Access28 May 2025

entry.title: Astrocyte morphogenesis requires self-recognition (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Astrocyte morphogenesis requires self-recognition

Human and mouse astrocytes express the protocadherin PcdhγC3, which promotes self-recognition of individual astrocytes, thereby contributing to normal astrocyte and brain development.

  • John H. Lee
  • Alina P. Sergeeva
  • S. Lawrence Zipursky
Article28 May 2025

entry.title: Preoptic EP3R neurons constitute a two-way switch for fever and torpor (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Preoptic EP3R neurons constitute a two-way switch for fever and torpor

Neurons in the median preoptic nucleus that express the prostaglandin EP3 receptor produce prolonged hypothermic responses or hyperthermic responses, respectively, following brief activation or inhibition.

  • Natalia L. S. Machado
  • Nicole Lynch
  • Clifford B. Saper
Article28 May 2025

entry.title: Radiative forcing reduced by early twenty-first century increase in land albedo (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Radiative forcing reduced by early twenty-first century increase in land albedo

Effects of snow cover dynamics, land use or land cover conversions and non-conversion regions on albedo variations during 2001–2020 are quantified and their induced radiative forcing estimated, highlighting the role of land surface dynamics in modulating global warming.

  • Zhengyang Hou
  • Liqiang Zhang
  • Liangpei Zhang
Article28 May 2025

entry.title: Air pollution modulates trends and variability of the global methane budget (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Air pollution modulates trends and variability of the global methane budget

An integrated observation-driven and model-driven approach demonstrates that, from 2005 to 2021, periods of high atmospheric methane growth were linked to trends and variations in OH levels driven by fluctuations in air pollutants, especially during extreme events.

  • Yuanhong Zhao
  • Bo Zheng
  • Philippe Bousquet
Article28 May 2025

entry.title: In vivo haemopoietic stem cell gene therapy enabled by postnatal trafficking (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
In vivo haemopoietic stem cell gene therapy enabled by postnatal trafficking

In vivo gene delivery to haematopoietic stem and progenitor cells in newborn mice using engineered lentiviral vectors shows promise as an effective treatment for genetic diseases.

  • Michela Milani
  • Anna Fabiano
  • Luigi Naldini
ArticleOpen Access28 May 2025

entry.title: Dating the evolution of oxygenic photosynthesis using La-Ce geochronology (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Dating the evolution of oxygenic photosynthesis using La-Ce geochronology

138La-138Ce geochronology shows that La/Ce fractionation, and Ce oxidation, occurred at the time of deposition, placing the origin of oxygenic photosynthesis in the Mesoarchaean or earlier.

  • Laureline A. Patry
  • Pierre Bonnand
  • Stefan V. Lalonde
Article28 May 2025

entry.title: Light-triggered regionally controlled n-doping of organic semiconductors (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Light-triggered regionally controlled n-doping of organic semiconductors

A facile light-triggered doping strategy involving a series of inactive photoactivable dopants is described that facilitates tunable regionally controlled n-doping of organic semiconductors, resulting in stable patterning of the doping profile at record high resolutions.

  • Xin-Yi Wang
  • Yi-Fan Ding
  • Jian Pei
Article28 May 2025

entry.title: Unconventional solitonic high-temperature superfluorescence from perovskites (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Unconventional solitonic high-temperature superfluorescence from perovskites

Exciton–lattice interactions suppress thermal noise through vibration isolation, enabling unconventional solitonic superfluorescence at unusually high temperatures in lead halide perovskites.

  • Melike Biliroglu
  • Mustafa Türe
  • Kenan Gundogdu
Article28 May 2025

entry.title: Observing anyonization of bosons in a quantum gas (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Observing anyonization of bosons in a quantum gas

Emergent anyonic correlations via spin–charge separation are observed in a one-dimensional strongly interacting quantum gas, enabling the exploration of non-equilibrium anyonic phenomena in a highly controllable setting.

  • Sudipta Dhar
  • Botao Wang
  • Hanns-Christoph Nägerl
ArticleOpen Access28 May 2025

entry.title: EndoMAP.v1 charts the structural landscape of human early endosome complexes (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
EndoMAP.v1 charts the structural landscape of human early endosome complexes

A study presents EndoMAP.v1, a resource that combines information on protein interactions and crosslink-supported structural predictions to map the interaction landscape of early endosomes.

  • Miguel A. Gonzalez-Lozano
  • Ernst W. Schmid
  • J. Wade Harper
ArticleOpen Access28 May 2025

entry.title: Dynamic basal ganglia output signals license and suppress forelimb movements (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Dynamic basal ganglia output signals license and suppress forelimb movements

Basal ganglia output neurons fire dynamically in bidirectional and movement-specific patterns to license forelimb movements. 

  • Antonio Falasconi
  • Harsh Kanodia
  • Silvia Arber
ArticleOpen Access28 May 2025

entry.title: The pivot penalty in research (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
The pivot penalty in research

An analysis of millions of scientific papers and patents reveals a ‘pivot penalty’ when researchers shift direction, with the impact of studies decreasing rapidly the further they move from their previous work.

  • Ryan Hill
  • Yian Yin
  • Benjamin F. Jones
ArticleOpen Access28 May 2025
